p: Gustatory dysfunction seems to accompany olfactory dysfunction and may occur independently from nasal symptoms of COVID-19 41. As with anosmia, dysgeusia was more prevalent among female patients with COVID-19 than male patients, in a multi-center European study by Leichen et. al ( 2020). This finding was attributed to ‘gender-related differences in the inflammatory reaction process’ (Lechien et al. 2020), however further investigation of the pathogenesis of dysgeusia in the setting of COVID-19 is warranted.
